item.title: How Berlin's Futuristic Airport Became a $6 Billion Embarrassment
item.description:
How Berlin's Futuristic Airport Became a $6 Billion Embarrassment

The inspectors could hardly believe what they were seeing. Summoned from their headquarters near Munich, the team of logistics, safety, and aviation experts had arrived at newly constructed Berlin Brandenburg International Willy Brandt Airport in the fall of 2011 to begin a lengthy series of checks and approvals for the â‚¬600 million ($656 million) terminal on the outskirts of the German capital.
